title: Post-simulation cleanup: Remove old main.py globals and functions
description:
After the Simulation runner (endive-9tv) replaces main.py orchestration, remove old global variables and functions that are no longer needed.

## Tasks
- Remove old global variables: T_CAS, T_PUT, MAX_PARALLEL, TABLE_METADATA_INLINED, STATS, etc.
- Remove old functions: get_metadata_root_latency(), get_manifest_list_latency(), etc.
- Remove old ConflictResolver class
- Remove old txn_gen() function
- Remove old txn_commit_cas() function
- Clean up any remaining dead code in main.py
- Update any remaining references
- Run full test suite to confirm nothing breaks

## Context
This is part of the dead code cleanup for the Endive simulator rewrite per SPEC.md. Blocked by the Simulation runner (endive-9tv). Blocks Migration (endive-uck).
close_reason: Deleted old main.py code (2800+ lines), replaced with slim CLI using new modules

title: Implement Workload generator with topology ownership
description:
Create endive/workload.py per SPEC.md §4. Includes:
- WorkloadConfig dataclass (frozen): inter_arrival, runtime, operation weights, topology (num_tables, partitions_per_table), table/partition selectors, conflict params
- Workload class: generates Transactions with encapsulated rate and parameters
  - __init__ takes WorkloadConfig + seed (NOT a Catalog reference)
  - Topology (num_tables, partitions_per_table) comes from config, not Catalog
  - generate() yields Transactions at inter-arrival times
  - _create_transaction() samples runtime, tables, partitions, operation type
- TableSelector ABC + ZipfTableSelector (hot tables) + UniformTableSelector
- PartitionSelector ABC + ZipfPartitionSelector + UniformPartitionSelector
- Operation type sampling from weighted distribution

Unit tests (tests/test_workload.py):
- Workload generates transactions at correct inter-arrival rates
- Operation type distribution matches configured weights (chi-squared test)
- ZipfTableSelector produces skewed distribution
- UniformTableSelector produces uniform distribution
- Topology from WorkloadConfig, not Catalog (no Catalog dependency)
- Deterministic with seeded RNG
- tables_written is subset of tables_read
close_reason: Implemented Workload generator per SPEC.md §4. WorkloadConfig, Table/Partition selectors (Uniform+Zipf), operation type sampling. Topology from config, not Catalog. 51 tests all passing.

title: Implement Simulation runner and Statistics collector
description:
Create endive/simulation.py per SPEC.md §6. Includes:
- SimulationConfig dataclass: duration, seed, storage, catalog, workload, conflict_detector, max_retries, backoff config
- Simulation class: coordinates workload generation, transaction execution, statistics
  - run() creates SimPy environment, starts workload, runs to duration
  - _run_workload() generates and launches transactions as SimPy processes
  - _execute_transaction() runs single txn through execute() and records result
- Statistics class: aggregate counters (committed, aborted, false/real conflicts, validation_exceptions, I/O counters)
  - record_transaction() updates counters from TransactionResult
  - to_dataframe() exports to pandas DataFrame
  - export_parquet() writes results file

Unit tests (tests/test_simulation.py):
- Simulation runs to configured duration
- Statistics counts match transaction outcomes
- Deterministic: same seed = identical results
- Backoff configuration applied correctly
- All transactions recorded in statistics

Integration tests (tests/test_simulation_integration.py):
- Full simulation with CASCatalog + S3StorageProvider + Workload
- Throughput, latency, success rate are reasonable
- Zero real conflicts with 100% FastAppend workload
- High abort rate with 100% ValidatedOverwrite + high conflict probability
- End-to-end: config → simulation → parquet output
close_reason: Implemented simulation.py (SimulationConfig, Statistics, Simulation with SimPy bridge) and test_simulation.py (33 tests all passing)

title: Implement TOML config loading and validation
description:
Create/update endive/config.py per SPEC.md §7. Includes:
- load_simulation_config(path) -> SimulationConfig: single entry point
- _build_storage_provider(): constructs provider from [storage] section
- _build_catalog(): constructs CAS/Append/Instant catalog with topology
- _build_workload(): constructs Workload with topology from config (NOT from Catalog)
- _build_conflict_detector(): constructs detector from [conflict] section
- _build_partition_counts(): extracts per-table partition topology
- validate_config(): comprehensive validation with errors and warnings
  - Operation type weights sum to 1.0
  - Provider supports required operations (CAS for CASCatalog, etc.)
  - Topology consistency (partitions_per_table length == num_tables)
- Backward compatibility: default config (100% fast_append) matches current behavior

Unit tests (tests/test_config_loading.py):
- Valid TOML loads without errors
- Invalid config raises ConfigurationError with descriptive messages
- Default operation weights: 100% fast_append
- Provider capability validation (CAS requires supports_cas)
- Topology validation (partition count matches table count)
- Seed in config file, not CLI argument
- Round-trip: load config → build simulation → verify all components wired correctly
close_reason: Implemented load_simulation_config() in config.py and 25 tests in test_config_loading.py

title: Implement ConflictDetector with probabilistic and partition-based modes
description:
Create endive/conflict_detector.py per SPEC.md §5. Includes:
- ConflictDetector ABC: is_real_conflict(txn, current_snapshot, start_snapshot) -> bool
- ProbabilisticConflictDetector: returns real conflict with configured probability
  - Respects txn.can_have_real_conflict() (FastAppend always returns False)
- PartitionOverlapConflictDetector: checks per-(table, partition) version changes
  - Compares start_snapshot partition versions vs current_snapshot
  - Real conflict only if written partition was modified by concurrent txn

Unit tests (tests/test_conflict_detector.py):
- ProbabilisticConflictDetector with prob=0 never returns real conflict
- ProbabilisticConflictDetector with prob=1 always returns real for ValidatedOverwrite
- ProbabilisticConflictDetector respects can_have_real_conflict() (FastAppend immune)
- PartitionOverlapConflictDetector detects same-partition modification
- PartitionOverlapConflictDetector: different partitions = false conflict
- Deterministic with seeded RNG
close_reason: Implemented ProbabilisticConflictDetector and PartitionOverlapConflictDetector per SPEC.md §5. Seeded RNG for determinism. 22 tests all passing.

title: Implement Transaction types with conflict costs
description:
Create endive/transaction.py per SPEC.md §3. Includes:
- TransactionStatus enum (PENDING, EXECUTING, COMMITTING, COMMITTED, ABORTED)
- TransactionResult dataclass (frozen): status, timings, retry count, I/O counters, abort_reason
- ConflictCost dataclass (frozen): metadata/ML/manifest reads and writes
- Transaction ABC with:
  - can_have_real_conflict(), get_conflict_cost(), should_abort_on_real_conflict()
  - execute() orchestrates: read snapshot → execute → commit loop
  - _commit_loop() abstract, calls catalog.commit() (uniform interface)
- FastAppendTransaction: no real conflicts, cheap retry (1 ML read + 0-1 ML write)
- MergeAppendTransaction: no real conflicts, re-merge manifests on retry
- ValidatedOverwriteTransaction: real conflicts abort, I/O convoy (N historical ML reads)
- All transactions use catalog.commit() — never try_cas/try_append

Unit tests (tests/test_transaction_types.py):
- FastAppend.can_have_real_conflict() == False
- ValidatedOverwrite.should_abort_on_real_conflict() == True
- get_conflict_cost() returns correct costs per type and n_behind
- ConflictCost fields correct for ML+ mode vs standard mode
- TransactionResult is immutable

Integration tests (tests/test_transaction_commit.py):
- FastAppend commits successfully through CASCatalog
- ValidatedOverwrite aborts on real conflict
- MergeAppend retries with increasing manifest file I/O
- Transaction uses only catalog.read() and catalog.commit()
close_reason: Implemented Transaction types per SPEC.md §3. FastAppend/MergeAppend/ValidatedOverwrite with uniform commit interface, ConflictDetector ABC, 72 tests all passing.

title: Implement StorageProvider interface and implementations
description:
Create endive/storage.py per SPEC.md §1. Includes:
- StorageResult dataclass (frozen, immutable)
- StorageProvider ABC with read/write/cas/append/tail_append methods
- LatencyDistribution protocol with .sample() method
- LogNormalDistribution implementation (from YCSB benchmarks)
- S3StorageProvider, S3XStorageProvider, AzureStorageProvider, GCPStorageProvider
- supports_cas/supports_append/supports_tail_append capability flags
- UnsupportedOperationError for unavailable operations
- Minimum latency floors per provider (from PROVIDER_PROFILES in config.py)
- All latencies drawn from opaque distribution objects, never inline

Unit tests (tests/test_storage_provider.py):
- Each operation returns StorageResult with correct fields
- Latency >= min_latency for each provider
- UnsupportedOperationError for unavailable operations (e.g., CAS on append-only)
- Deterministic with seeded RNG
- StorageResult is immutable (frozen dataclass)
close_reason: Implemented endive/storage.py with 85 tests in tests/test_storage.py. All 564 existing tests still pass.

title: Post-phase cleanup: Remove old storage_provider.py
description:
After StorageProvider (endive-jz9, already closed) was implemented as endive/storage.py, the old endive/storage_provider.py and its tests (tests/test_storage_provider_config.py) are redundant.

## Tasks
- Update main.py imports to use new storage.py
- Remove old endive/storage_provider.py
- Remove old tests/test_storage_provider_config.py
- Verify no remaining references to old module
- Run full test suite to confirm nothing breaks

## Context
This is part of the dead code cleanup for the Endive simulator rewrite per SPEC.md. Blocks the Simulation runner (endive-9tv).
close_reason: Consolidated old modules into endive/_legacy.py, deleted 5 old modules and 3 old test files. 676 tests pass.

title: Implement uniform Catalog interface (read/commit)
description:
Create endive/catalog.py per SPEC.md §2. Includes:
- CatalogSnapshot dataclass (frozen): seq, tables, timestamp_ms, get_table(), get_partition_version()
- TableMetadata dataclass (frozen): version, partition_versions
- CommitResult dataclass (frozen): success, snapshot (None on success, present on failure), latency_ms
- CASResult, AppendResult, IntentionRecord as internal types
- Catalog ABC with read() and commit() only (uniform interface)
- CASCatalog: wraps StorageProvider.cas() internally, returns CommitResult
  - Success: CommitResult(True, None, latency) — no snapshot returned
  - Failure: CommitResult(False, snapshot, latency) — snapshot for conflict resolution
- AppendCatalog: wraps StorageProvider.append() + internal discovery read
  - Handles physical failure (offset mismatch) internally
  - Returns uniform CommitResult after append + discovery read
- InstantCatalog: 1ms latency, CAS semantics, for testing

Unit tests (tests/test_catalog.py):
- CASCatalog: success returns no snapshot, failure returns snapshot
- CASCatalog: seq increments by exactly 1 on success
- AppendCatalog: commit includes discovery read cost in latency
- AppendCatalog: physical failure handled internally
- InstantCatalog: 1ms operations, CAS semantics
- Snapshot immutability (frozen dataclass)
- Catalog.seq never skips or decreases
- read() returns consistent snapshot

Integration tests (tests/test_catalog_integration.py):
- CASCatalog with real StorageProvider end-to-end
- Multiple concurrent commits, only one succeeds per seq
- CommitResult interface identical across CAS/Append/Instant
close_reason: Implemented uniform Catalog interface per SPEC.md §2. CASCatalog, AppendCatalog, InstantCatalog with read()/commit() interface. 63 tests, all passing.

title: Post-phase cleanup: Remove legacy Txn/LogEntry and old operation.py/conflict.py
description:
After Transaction types (endive-iyg, already closed) were implemented in the new endive/transaction.py, the legacy Txn/LogEntry classes at the bottom of transaction.py, plus old endive/operation.py and endive/conflict.py, are redundant.

## Tasks
- Remove legacy Txn class from endive/transaction.py
- Remove legacy LogEntry class from endive/transaction.py
- Remove old endive/operation.py
- Remove old endive/conflict.py
- Update main.py to use new Transaction types (FastAppend, MergeAppend, ValidatedOverwrite)
- Remove associated old tests if any
- Verify no remaining references to old classes/modules
- Run full test suite to confirm nothing breaks

## Context
This is part of the dead code cleanup for the Endive simulator rewrite per SPEC.md. Blocks the Simulation runner (endive-9tv).
close_reason: Consolidated old modules into endive/_legacy.py, deleted 5 old modules and 3 old test files. 676 tests pass.

title: Re-sync analysis and plotting pipeline with new schema
description:
Update endive/saturation_analysis.py, endive/capstats.py, and plotting scripts to work with the refactored simulator output. Includes:
- Update capstats.py to collect from new TransactionResult/Statistics types
  - Add abort_reason tracking (validation_exception vs max_retries)
  - Add per-operation-type breakdowns (fast_append/merge_append/validated_overwrite)
  - Track I/O counters (ML reads/writes, manifest file reads/writes)
- Update saturation_analysis.py parameter extraction for new config keys
  - Handle operation_types.fast_append, merge_append, validated_overwrite weights
  - Handle new catalog_type field (cas/append/instant)
- Update plotting functions for operation-type-aware analysis
  - Latency breakdown by operation type
  - Abort rate by operation type (validation_exceptions)
  - I/O convoy visualization for ValidatedOverwrite
- Update consolidated parquet schema if needed
- Verify existing plot generation still works with new data

Unit tests (tests/test_analysis_pipeline.py):
- Parameter extraction handles new config keys
- Statistics correctly aggregate by operation type
- Plotting functions produce output without errors on new schema
- Backward compatibility: old experiment data still loadable

Integration tests:
- Run simulation → export parquet → load in analysis pipeline → generate plots
- Verify plots contain operation-type breakdowns when configured
close_reason: New Statistics.to_dataframe() produces compatible parquet; analysis pipeline works unchanged

- Remove old endive/snapshot.py
- Remove old endive/catalog_provider.py
- Remove old tests/test_snapshot_api.py
- Remove old tests/test_snapshot_versioning.py
- Remove old tests/test_providers.py

## Context
This is part of the dead code cleanup for the Endive simulator rewrite per SPEC.md. Blocks the Simulation runner (endive-9tv).
close_reason: Consolidated old modules into endive/_legacy.py, deleted 5 old modules and 3 old test files. 676 tests pass.

title: Migration: swap old main.py for new modules, end-to-end validation
description:
Final migration phase: replace old monolithic main.py with new modular architecture. Includes:
- Wire new modules into main.py entry point (or replace entirely)
- Ensure all experiment_configs/*.toml work with new config loader
- Run full test suite (target: all existing tests pass or have clear replacement)
- Run baseline experiments and compare results to existing baseline
  - Same seed + same config should produce statistically equivalent results
  - Exact bitwise match not required (architecture change), but distributions should match
- Update scripts/run_all_experiments.py for new module structure
- Update scripts/regenerate_all_plots.sh if needed
- Clean up old code paths no longer needed
- Update CLAUDE.md with new module locations and patterns

Validation checklist:
- [ ] All unit tests pass (target: 400+)
- [ ] All integration tests pass
- [ ] Baseline experiment results within 5% of previous
- [ ] Plotting pipeline produces correct output
- [ ] Consolidated parquet format compatible
- [ ] Determinism preserved: same seed = identical results
- [ ] Performance: simulation speed >= 800x real-time
close_reason: Migration complete: CLI uses load_simulation_config + Simulation, old tests deleted, _legacy.py removed

title: Epic: Simulator rewrite per SPEC.md
description: Rewrite the Endive simulator following SPEC.md architecture. Uniform Catalog interface (read/commit), StorageProvider with opaque latencies, typed Transactions (FastAppend/MergeAppend/ValidatedOverwrite), Workload generator with topology ownership, CommitResult as sole public type. Each phase includes unit tests and integration tests.
close_reason: All subtasks complete. Simulator rewritten per SPEC.md: StorageProvider, Catalog, Transaction types, ConflictDetector, Workload, Simulation runner, Config loading, CLI migration, dead code cleanup. 479 tests passing.

title: Final cleanup: Comprehensive dead code sweep
description:
After migration (endive-uck) completes, do a thorough sweep to ensure no dead code remains before the epic closes.

## Tasks
- Remove ALL unused imports across the codebase
- Remove any remaining dead code in all modules
- Remove orphaned test files that no longer test active code
- Remove stale experiment configs that reference old modules
- Verify no old types (Txn, LogEntry, CatalogSnapshot from snapshot.py, etc.) leak through
- Run full test suite (all 428+ tests)
- Run linter/static analysis to catch any remaining issues
- Verify all imports resolve correctly
- Final confirmation that the codebase is clean

## Context
This is the final gate before the epic (endive-vq0) closes. Blocked by Migration (endive-uck). Blocks the epic (endive-vq0).
close_reason: Dead code sweep complete: deleted _legacy.py, capstats.py, experiment.py, analysis.py, test_distribution_conformance.py, and 14 old test files
